title: Hima Das revealed Indian athlete win gold world championship
story: Hima Das placed first at the 2018 IAAF World U-20 Championships now underway in FinlandWho is Hima Das?Hima Das is an Indian sprinter who recently made history by being the first Indian athlete to win the gold medal in the women’s 400 meter event at the 2018 IAAF World U-20 Championships in Tampere, Finland, also making her the first athlete from India to win a gold medal at any global track event.She was born in Nagaon, Assam, India on Janaury 9, 2000.The youngest in a family of six children, she grew up in a rural village surrounded by rice fields and enjoyed playing football while growing up. She later met Nipon Das, a coach with the Directorate of Sports and Youth Welfare, while at an athletics meet, who soon took up the role as her new coach and mentor.She later relocated to Guwahati to train at the Sarusajai Sports Complex, quickly becoming known as one of India’s most promising young athletes.Her coach Nipon Das continued to giver her guidance, saying: 'I keep telling Hima only one thing: Dream big. Because only a few are blessed with God-given talent. My aim was to try and make sure she is part of the relay team for the Asian Games. But she has surpassed all expectations by winning a world championship gold in the inidual event.'After competing at the 2018 Commonwealth Games in Australia, she later made history as the first track athlete from India to win a gold medal at any worldwide event after placing first in the women’s 400 meter event at the 2018 World U-20 Championships in Tampere, Finland on July 12, clocking in at 51.46 seconds.How old is Hima Das?Hima Das is 18-years-old.She was born on January 9, 2000.          Das's time of 51.46 seconds at the 2018 World U-20 Championships helped her make historyHima Das at the 2018 Commonwealth GamesIn addition to her recent historic success at the IAAF U-20 championship, Das also competed at the 2018 Commonwealth Games in Gold Coast, Australia.Das ultimately placed sixth at the women’s 400-meter event, clocking in a new personal best time of 51.32 seconds, helping her qualify for the semifinals.‘I gave it my best and realized that I can compete against the big guns. They are all quite seniors while I am still junior,’ she said after the race.She also competed in the women’s 4x400 meter relay, helping India finish seventh at the event with a time of three minutes and 33.61 seconds.Who is Olivia Colman? title: Sky weather girl Nazaneen Ghaffar trolled online
story: Nazaneen was reduced to tears after she received the online abuse but was flooded with support from fans and her co-presenters at the networkSharing the tweet from the troll, who goes by the name ultimategrumpy, Nazaneen wrote: 'Why is MY weight any of YOUR concern?'Think before you speak.'You don't know what's going on in my private life. And regardless I am still the same person on the inside - whatever my weight. That's all that matters.'Colleagues and fans have flocked to her defence, with Sky presenter Kimberley Leonard saying: 'One of the most naturally beautiful people I know and one of the nicest.'          Fan and co-workers flocked to support the 'naturally beautiful' presenter who had worked for Sky since 2010. She has received over 100 comments of supportBBC weather presenter Behnaz Akhgar wrote: 'I think you look amazing... Who is this crazy person?' Sky Sports' William Esler added: 'Absolutely ridiculous that somebody would think it was acceptable to send that.'A heartwarming message from viewer Tony Strange said: 'Ignore him. I have enjoyed waking up to your weather forecasts for years and long may it continue.          Eamonn Holmes with the Sky News Sunrise team in 2010. From left, Isobel Lang, Jacquie Beltrau, Holmes, Charlotte Hawkins and Nazaneen'The day is always sunny when you're on, no matter what.' Later the 33-year-old who's married to BBC reporter Charlie Rose, sent a tweet out thanking her fans for their support which gives her 'the incentive  to wake up every morning at 3.30am'She wrote : 'Thank you to every single one of you who replied to my previous horrid tweet.          The Sunrise presenter re-tweeted the horrid message from the online troll with a response which read: 'Why is MY weight of YOUR concern?''I immediately regretted giving him the satisfaction of my attention by retweeting it and I'm ashamed to say it did make me cry. I know, stupid.'But then I read all your wonderful messages and I felt like I had the longest, warmest, and biggest virtual hug - and that's why I love my job, because you all care about my weather forecasts no matter how big or small I am, or how sunny or cloudy it is!          The Sunrise presenter with her husband BBC reporter Charlie Rose'I'm not going to lie, when my alarm goes off for work at 3.30am it's hard to wake up, but knowing you guys are going to tune in and watch for your day's weather forecast makes me happy and I feel so privileged to be able to do that for you all.'Thank you so much.'Ghaffar started her career as a runner on Deal or No Deal before working at BBC South East and ITV West before joining Sky.

title: I did 20 workouts 48 hours dont to
story: Mail on Sunday's deputy health editor Eve Simmons, pictured in San Diego, California attended the world's largest exercise eventStreams of fluorescent disco lights flood the 4,000-capacity auditorium. Around me an army of eager, Lycra-clad men and women stand in neat rows, shoulder width apart, eyes widened. Ear-bleedingly loud dance music pumps through the speakers as Heidi and Chris Powell – the stars of US hit reality show Extreme Weight Loss – take the stage to lead an exercise class that will help us reach our ‘pain threshold’ and ‘burn optimum body fat’.Someone in the crowd screams. Another cries. It’s not yet 7.30am. Welcome to the first day of the world’s biggest fitness convention: Idea World, in San Diego, southern California.Dubbed the ‘superbowl of the fitness industry’, the annual event brings together more than 200 fitness industry professionals, trainers and celebrity weight-loss gurus, alongside 14,000 exercise fanatics from all around the globe.They flock to the four-day festival to find the latest innovations and trends in workouts, equipment and technology on offer. And what debuts here quickly makes its way into gyms across the Atlantic.Justin Webb: Why I'll stick with walking my labradoodle...I can cry and scream when I'm running: TANA RAMSAY explains...Share this articleThe expo has launched countless products, machines and exercises during its 36-year run, from vibrating power plates to Zumba.As a long-time exercise-avoider with minimal muscle mass, I’ve always struggled to find an exercise class I enjoy. So, as the only British journalist invited to attend this year, would I discover one I could actually bear?COULD I GET MADONNA’S BOTTOM?The exhaustive list of almost 400 classes, workouts and evening activities at Idea World is overwhelming I commit to 25 classes over a period of 48 hours.Only the most sweat-inducing make my cut.After the Powells’ Extreme Transformation Workout, an endless series of muscle-toning exercises performed for three minutes at a time, I move on to a BOSU class: exercises practised aboard a squishy rubber dome.Instructor Alison demonstrates how to ‘paddle’ with my steel bar in hand, engaging the core and glutes for ‘bums and tums’ tightening.          Over the course of 48 hours, Eve tried out 20 different work outs at the Idea World fitness convention in San Diego, CaliforniaFinding my balance on the rubber sphere is tough enough let alone extending opposite arm and legs simultaneously. Remarkably, by focusing on a spot on the wall in front of me, I’m able to complete the rest of the routine with minimal wobbling.After Tae Bo, a mixture of martial arts and aerobics, comes Booty Barre – a class especially designed to build a beautiful bottom.The workout – whose fans include Madonna – draws on the principles of Pilates and ballet.As a regular Pilates goer, I was fairly confident I’d get through the hour with ease, but after five minutes of thrusting with a medicine ball between my legs – on tiptoes – I realise this isn’t the case.By the end of the class, my thighs are like jelly and I’m starving hungry. It’s 10am.BOOT CAMP, BOXING... AND BATTLE ROPESI decide to get the worst out the way before lunchtime: army boot camp.Developed by a former US sergeant, this is a 90-minute sweatathon involving jumping squats, lunges and sprints interspersed with military-style marches. Angry orders from Sergeant Ken Weichart (aka Sgt Ken) to ‘Embrace The Pain!’ keep me moving despite the agony but after 50 rapid squats and the sergeant’s demands to ‘get lower’, I succumb to the pain and embarrassingly stumble mid-rep. ‘No quitters here!’ Ken loudly reminds me.I manage a 30-minute lunch break before leaping straight into the on-site boxing ring for a couple of rounds with a bullish, bald-headed former champ.          This odd-looking device is supposed to provide a work out for bums and tumsTo my surprise, I can throw a mean punch and even manage a spin, kick and smack move.Then I move across to Battle Ropes. After 15 minutes of tutorial, we experiment with all 30 ways a 55 lb, 50ft rope can be moved about for a vigorous full-body workout.It’s not all about waving it with the hands – try jumping between two ropes for a quick warm-up, or lifting the ropes in between press-ups to work the core and arms. At the end of the class, I unashamedly collapse on the floor into a pool of my own sweat and admit defeat. Tomorrow is another day…TORTURE... FOR KILLER ABSOn day two, I explore the 500,000 square foot exhibition hall showcasing almost 400 cutting-edge fitness gadgets and machinery.I start with a demonstration of the latest vibrating Power Plate to hit US gyms. The machine stimulates muscles with vibration, increasing muscle tone when exercising. I expect to watch my love handles wiggle off my body without moving but unfortunately, some work is required. I try step-ups and single leg balances, before moving on to planks, bridges and seated crunches – all aboard the vibrating platform. Each exercise feels ten times more intense than I’d ever experienced before, with ripples of pain shooting through my entire body.Converts claim that those ten minutes of excruciating torture are the fastest route to killer abs.Other highlights of the exhibition include a 6ft stair-climbing machine which, on maximum resistance, feels five times harder than normal stairs a virtual-reality treadmill that sends me running through the French countryside and a cycling machine called Real Ryder which tilts 22 degrees and emits stimulating vibrations. I disembark the bike, feeling two stone lighter, and seek out an upper-body exercise to give my legs some well-earned rest.          Eve, right, pictured with Sgt Ken Weichert, left, is receiving her orders 2 GET PULSED danceWHAT IS IT?A 60-minute class using weights to tone the lower body. Movements are syncronised to song lyrics making routines easy to follow.HOW DOES IT HELP?More than 600 calories are burned in just one hour.HOW DO I FIND OUT MORE?Not available in the UK yet, but see getpulsed.com. Search for a dance class local to you at emduk.org.3 BILLY BLANKS  tae-boWHAT IS IT?A total body workout combining kick-boxing, martial arts, aerobics and self-defence.HOW DOES IT HELP?Dynamic punching and kicking to upbeat pop music improves both cardiovascular fitness and muscle strength.HOW DO I FIND OUT MORE?Blanks’s how-to exercise videos are free at taebo.com.4 BOLLY-X dance classWHAT IS IT?A 50-minute dance-based class inspired by Bollywood routines.HOW DOES IT HELP?Instructors don’t stop throughout the class, expecting you to catch up as they move seamlessly through movements. The result is 50 minutes of non-stop cardio workout.HOW DO I FIND OUT MORE?BollyX classes are yet to hit the UK but online workouts are available at bod.bollyx.com costing £6.79 per month.5 PIYO (Pilates plus yoga)WHAT IS IT?PiYo is a 25-minute, ramped-up Pilates and yoga hybrid pioneered by celebrity trainer Charlene Johnson. Fluid sequences are speeded-up and movements are dynamic and challenging.HOW DOES IT HELP?The fast pace burns more fat than a standard yoga or Pilates class, while maintaining the flexibility benefits.HOW DO I FIND OUT MORE?Search for your nearest PiYo class at beachbody live.com.

title: Bath University academics urged stop saying know case students feel inadequate
story: Academics at Bath University (pictured) have been urged to avoid saying ‘as you know’ in case students will be left feeling inadequateJoanna Williams, a former university lecturer and author, criticised the advice last night. She said: ‘The assumption that students can’t cope with the common expression “as you know” is ridiculous.’She suggested such ideas were being generated by administrators and academics ‘who need to justify their salaries’ and who planted them in the heads of student union activists when the majority of undergraduates were ‘far more sensible and would not freak out’ if a lecturer used the phrase.Top school that's using 'symbols' to mark examsBooks will soon need content warnings because 'snowflake'...Share this articleThe equality and ersity network meeting had been focusing on the attainment gap between white and non-white students – who in some years were said were to be ‘50 per cent less likely to attain a good degree’ – when the advice was given.Bath is currently ranked the sixth-best university in The Guardian University Guide and 11th in The Complete University Guide.          Joanna Williams, pictured, said: ‘The assumption that students can’t cope with the common expression “as you know” is ridiculous’Its alumni include former RAF Chief of Staff Sir Stephen Dalton, Justin King, former chief executive of Sainsbury’s, and Sir Julian Horn-Smith, former chief operating officer at Vodafone.In recent years, universities have been making increasing efforts to protect a so-called ‘snowflake generation’ of students, cosseting them away from controversial content or issues.Examples include advice to students by Oxford University’s equality and ersity unit that failing to make eye contact or speak directly to people could be deemed a ‘racial microaggression’, and a warning to English students by lecturers at Cambridge University that plays by William Shakespeare could contain upsetting gore and violence.A spokesman for Bath University said the equality and ersity network had a ‘broad membership’ and was a forum for debate.He added: ‘One of the good things about universities is having the freedom of speech to discuss equality and ersity openly. Our students are bright, curious and frequently challenge received wisdom – and we wouldn’t want it any other way.’

title: Gurkhas open ranks women time
story: Teenage Nepali boys await the start of a recruitment test for the Gurkha Regiment called the Doko race          A young Nepali boy carries a 55lb bag and races up a hillHopefuls who are selected to become Gurkhas then head to British shores to take up a 10-week course in Catterick, North Yorkshire. The village could be welcoming women from spring 2020.  As well as extensive fitness training, those at that make it have English language and culture lessons on top of learning infantry skills.  A scheme was piloted by the Ministry of Defence in 2007, when around 50 Nepalese women took part in fitness tests, but ultimately the brigade remained closed.   British colonial forces 'raped a teenager and tortured...They don't make them like this anymore: Peer who was the...Share this articleGurkhas begin on a starting salary of £18,000 and a pension, plus the right to settle in the UK - a huge wage by Nepali standards.Currently 3000 Gurkhas serve in the British army, and about 250 are recruited a year form Pokhara, central Nepal.   But army officers have drawn up plans to add another 800 troops to the force, according to the Sunday Times. Defence secretary Gavin Williamson said: 'The Gurkhas are renowned as one of the best fighting forces in the world with a proud history of serving Her Majesty, and it is right that women have the opportunity to serve in this elite group.'

title: Royal Navy sailors reception fit heroes return home
story: Royal Navy sailors received a reception fit for heroes on their return home after a six-month deployment across the Mediterranean and Black Sea          Emotions were running high as people waited at Portsmouth Naval Base for the ship’s company of HMS DuncanIt had spent more than half a year as the flagship in Nato’s Standing Maritime Group 2 (SNMG2) travelling around the Mediterranean, Aegean and Black Sea.After heading out on January 8 this year, the ship carried out defence engagement activities alongside Nato Partners and provided an air defence shield for Nato-led air strikes in Syria.Sir Alex Ferguson 'dodged a bullet' and is extremely lucky...Royal family 'snub' Trump: Prince Charles and Prince William...'It's the most horrific crime scene I've ever attended':...Labour party bosses 'fooled Jeremy Corbyn and his aides at...Share this articleThe crew and ship also rescued two Algerian fishermen who had been lost at sea for numerous days.Then the wartime ship journeyed to The Gulf where it protected shipping lanes and worked on engagement activities alongside regional and international partners.          Families holding banners and signs cheered as the Type 45 destroyer came into view, while the crew waved back from the deck           The £1billion warship - home to a 200-strong complement - made its way back to the city, its home port, Friday afternoon          Commander of SNMG2, commodore Mike Utley from the Royal Navy, said: ‘To command SNMG2 during a successful deployment and a period of significant UK contribution to NATO has been an honour.‘I am proud of the achievements and the contributions made to maritime security, regional stability and defence engagement whilst operating in the Mediterranean and Black Sea.‘The delivery of such strategic effect has been made possible by having a highly capable and versatile Flagship such as HMS Duncan and all the allied ships which have worked with us,’ reported The News.Paul Chuckle - one half of the comedy duo, the Chuckle brothers -was near the area and posted out a shout out to HMS Duncan.He wrote: ‘HMS Duncan arriving #Portsmouth .... might see it on the way out.’Duncan will deploy in 2019.HMS Duncan set to return to Portsmouth this afternoon - The News

title: Travellers pitch 30 caravans beauty spot JRR Tolkien used inspiration middle earth
story: Dozens of traveller families have angered locals after pitching up at a world famous beauty spot, that was the inspiration for Lord of the Rings          The 18th Century mill is a well known tourist destination run by Birmingham City Council and has a number of famous literary connections, most notably to JRR Tolkien          Tolkien lived just yards away and in later life said how the mill and rural surroundings inspired his writing of middle earth          Locals in Birmingham are fuming after travellers pitched up at a world famous beauty spot - which inspired JRR Tolkien's Lord Of The Rings.The grounds nearby host the annual Tolkien Weekend event that celebrates the life and works of Tolkien.But now cars, vans and caravans, many with Irish number plates, are sprawled over about three acres of the site, blotting out the silhouette of the 18th century mill.A local 38-year-old woman, who did not want to be named said: 'It's not only the fact they camp on this beautiful parkland, it's the fact they leave such a mess when they leave.Welcome home! Royal Navy sailors get reception fit for...Share this article'Birmingham City Council need to do something about this it getting out of hand, they are now coming in vast numbers, I've never known anything like it.'Another local Alan Hart, said: 'The last time they came the left a hell of a mess, there is just too many of them, they're making life a misery for us.'Matthew Hudson, said: 'It's getting too much, the council needs to step in and do something about this, they'll leave a hell of a mess when they go.'          An aerial view of the campsite where 30 caravans have pitched up          Cars, vans and caravans, many with Irish number plates, are sprawled over about three acres of the site, blotting out the silhouette of the 18th century mi          J.R.R Tolkien author of the Lord of the Rings trilogy and The Hobbit lived just yards away from the millThe mill is a well known tourist destination run by Birmingham City Council and has a number of famous literary connections, most notably J.R.R Tolkien author of the Lord of the Rings trilogy and The Hobbit.He lived across the road and in later life said how the mill and rural surroundings inspired his writing of middle earth.Speaking about Sarehole Mill in 1966 he said: 'It was a kind of lost paradise, there was an old mill that really did ground corn with two millers, a great big pond with swans on it, a sandpit, a wonderful dell with flowers, a few old fashioned village houses and, further away, a stream with another mill.'

title: Right wingers fascist salutes amid plans remains Spanish dictator Franco Franco
story: Demonstrators give the fascist salute at the protest against the exhumation of late Spanish dictator Francisco Franco  Franco  is the only person who is buried at the site who didn't die in the Spanish Civil War          The Valley of the Fallen' memorial is dedicated to the 500,000 victims of the Spanish Civil War          Far right-wing supporters at the protest holding a pre-constitutional Spanish flagSpanish doctor goes on trial accused of stealing newborn...Migrants in stand-off threaten mutiny in the Med: The 629...Michael Portillo's father is accused of making up famous...Share this articleAt the demonstration this morning, protesters, who fiercely oppose the move, gave fascist salutes and sang 'Cara al Sol' - the anthem of the fascist Phalange party.Some were carrying flags used when Franco was in power, which were confiscated by the Guardia Civil police, under a law banning the promotion of the civil war at the site.The protest was held as people lined up outside the Catholic mausoleum, which was built by prisoners of war over 19 years, to attend a mass. The protest comes after a far-right group called for a 'national, patriotic and religious pilgrimage' to prevent 'the plunder' of his grave by Spain's new Socialist government. Franco, who killed up to 50,000 of his own countrymen, is the only person at the site who didn't die in the Civil War.The Phalange party founder Jose Antonio Primo de Rivera is also buried at this isive monument to the civil war and the dictatorship that followed.           The demonstration comes after a far-right group called for a 'national, patriotic and religious pilgrimage' to prevent 'the plunder' of his grave by Spain's new Socialist government          Franco's descendants are completely opposed to removing his remains, although no date has been set for the move

title: Anthony Bourdain spoke Clinton Weinstein one final interviews
story: Anthony Bourdain, who took his own life in France in June, gave a lengthy and wide-ranging interview to journalist Maria Bustillos for her recently launched magazine Popula'Bill Clinton, look, the bimbo eruptions - it was f***king monstrous,' Bourdain said, before describing the former presidents as 'a piece of s**t, entitled, rapey, gropey, grabby, disgusting'.Bourdain went on to condemn the way Clinton and wife Hillary 'destroyed these women' who came forward with the allegations.'He is a very charming man, I met him, he's f**king magnetic. As is (Hillary). When you're in the room, you think wow, she's really warm and nice and funny. But the way they efficiently dismantled, destroyed, and shamelessly discredited these women for speaking their truth.'Bourdain, who had been dating Italian actress Asia Argento - one of Weinstein's first accusers, also spoke of Hillary's response to the wave of sexual assault allegations leveled against the Hollywood producer.Soon after the allegations started piling up about Weinstein, Hillary said she was 'appalled' and denied having any knowledge of what was happening behind closed doors.'It was something that was just intolerable in every way,' Hillary said at the time. 'And, you know, like so many people who've come forward and spoken out, this was a different side of a person who I and many others had known in the past.'   Bourdain - one of the most outspoken male supporters of the #MeToo movement - touched on Bill Clinton's sexual misconduct allegations, slamming the former president and his wife Hillary for the way they 'destroyed' those womenWeinstein hosted events and donated personally to Clinton ever since she first ran for public office back in 1999 as a senator for the state of New York. Bourdain publicly slammed Hillary on Twitter calling her response 'shameful in its deflection and its disingenuousness'. When asked about Clinton's response in his February interview, Bourdain said: 'I will tell you that as frightening as that was at times, when I sat there with Asia, as she texted her sisters… watching the Clinton apology on Weinstein, and (Asia's) watching this statement, there was a lot of anticipation. 'People were really hoping she'd come out with a… I don't know. Let's just say with something different. I immediately tweeted my disappointment, very much shaped by what I saw around me. And I will tell you, that was really f**king frightening, the reaction to that. You know, I voted for her.Anthony Bourdain receives SIX Emmy nominations for his CNN...Share this article'I was really disappointed with the statement. But even by expressing that (on Twitter), the way that my comment was turned, very neatly - suddenly I wasn't expressing disappointment in her statement I was blaming her for Harvey Weinstein's crimes. The way that turned very nicely was a good bit of artistry and deeply frightening to me.'Specifically on Weinstein, Bourdain said while he would have liked to see the producer 'beaten to death in his cell', he had imagined something much different.'My theory of how he goes is he's brushing his teeth in a bathroom, he's naked in his famous bathrobe, which is flapping open, he's holding his cell phone in one hand because you never know who on the Weinstein board has betrayed him recently, and he's brushing his teeth,' Bourdain said.          Specifically on Weinstein, Bourdain said while he would have liked to see the producer 'beaten to death in his cell', he had imagined him dying alone in his bathtub dressed in a robe          Bourdain, who had been dating Italian actress Asia Argento - one of Weinstein's first accusers, mentioned that he was sitting next to his girlfriend as they listened to Hillary Clinton respond to the allegations'He suddenly gets a massive f**king stroke - he stumbles backwards into the bathtub, where he finds himself with his robe open feet sticking out of the tub, and in his last moments of consciousness as he scrolls through his contacts list trying to figure out who he can call, who will actually answer the phone.'The interview also covered current politics in the Trump-era with Bourdain saying he would be filling to compromise his principles in exchange for some 'f**king competency' and for someone who has an understanding of how government works. 'It's like, that's okay, cause Jared will brief me later. Does Jared tweeze his eyebrows? They look manscaped. Those are not natural eyebrows. It's like Howdy Doody time,' Bourdain said. 'Can you see eight guys standing around, and Jared's out of the room? And they're all co-conspirators, they're all saying, 'ey don't worry bout Jared, he's f**kin' solid, the guy will stand up, he ain't gonna say nothin'.'No one has ever said that! That f**kin little punk is gonna squeal, just show him a tray of jail food, the guy will f**kin shit himself. That kid was a born snitch.' The lengthy interview with Bourdain was conducted months before he took his life in early June in eastern France where he was working on an episode of his show.Bourdain received several posthumous Emmy nominations last Thursday for his CNN series 'Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown'.

title: Family stuck waist high mud Somerset beach
story: A family had to be rescued from the mud after they became stuck, waist-high on Saturday          The group were pulled from the mud near Weston-Super-Mare and brought back to shoreTwo hovercrafts took rescuers out to the scene and the family were pulled from the mud and taken back to safety.It was a busy day for the hovercraft crew, who later rescued another boy from the mud.A Burnham Area Rescue Boat (BARB) spokesman said of the first rescue: 'The group was given safety advice about the danger of the mud and checked over by paramedics before being released.Stranded family are dramatically rescued from rocks after...Will heatwave continue for ANOTHER 40 days and nights?...Share this article'It was established that the group of four adults and a child were doing OK and had been enjoying a challenging walk and insisted they were in no difficulty.'Although this was the case, the concerns are that they had been out in very harsh heat without any water and the exertion of walking through the mud can lead to dehydration.          The group of four men and child became stuck in the mud after the tide went out          Rescuers pulled them free before the tide turned and started coming back inThe spokesman added: 'A little-known fact is that even in this heat you can also become cold and possibly hypothermic due to sweating from the effort of walking and then stopping and being covered in mud plus the windchill.''As our crews were preparing to leave the scene, several further mud walkers were seen wading through mud near the Grand Pier, with the tide now incoming.'BARBs hovercrafts were tasked by Coastguards to fly out to them, and a young child was flown from the tideline back to her relieved parents.'

title: Putin rolls Helsinki overseas use new Kortezh limousine
story: Vladimir Putin arrived in Helsinki inside his new presidential limousine, the Aurus Senat, which took six years to develop and was first used at his inauguration earlier this year           The car is able to be fully submerged in water without harming the occupants, according to Russian media, and also features tyres reinforced with steel wire to stop them bursting           Russia began developing the Senat in 2012 and has so far spent $300million on the project which will also lead to smaller four-door and minivan vehicles which will be sold to the public           Russian President Vladimir Putin waves upon his arrival at the Helsinki-Vantaa Airport as he climbs into his limousine          The first time the limousine was seen was during Putin inauguration when it made a short journey from the Kremlin's Senate Building in Moscow to Andreevsky Hall (pictured)Russia began developing the Senat limo as part of a family of family of vehicles dubbed Kortezh in 2012 and has so-far spent $300million on the project, according to The Drive.The vehicle measures 23ft long, which is slightly longer than The Beast, but is lighter, weighing in at 6.5 tons.Given how much it weighs the vehicle almost certainly features armour plating and a reinforced chassis to withstand bomb blasts, though Russia has not revealed any of these details.The Senat is powered by a twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter Porsche-developed V8 engine and will replace the adapted Mercedes-Benz Pullman limousine which Russian presidents have used since 1994.'Very good start': Trump's direct talks with Putin go into...Trump begins Helsinki summit by bashing U.S. 'foolishness...Trump finally gets the praise he has been coveting from the...Share this articleInside, the limousine is decked out with white leather seats and wood detailing and features a large Russian coat of arms stitched into the door.It also features a digital dashboard and on board multimedia system. Russia is also developing four-door and minivan concepts based on the limousine which will be sold to the public, some of which featured in Putin's motorcade. According to the Financial Express, the car was jointly developed with German firms Porsche and Bosch along with Moscow-based Central Scientific Research Automobile &amp Engine Institute.It reportedly gets 592 horsepower. Russian leaders traveled in a Russian-made ZILS under Soviet Times, and later in Mercedes-Benz vehicles. It wasn't immediately known what security capabilities it has, but 'the Beast' has puncture resistant tires, armored plating, protection from bio chemical attack, and a sealed gas tank.Shocking video shows driver knocking cyclists off their bikesMan filming humiliates woman as she return armour plating, night vision cameras and a sealed main compartment that can withstand a chemical attack           The Beast also features gas canister cannons, pump action shotguns and assault rifles, reinforced tyres, a fuel tank that will not explode even after a direct hit, and several pints of the President's blood  Donald Trump's bomb proof limo has been designed to survive a military-style or chemical warfare attackMeanwhile The Beast is a seven-seat black limousine which is designed to give Mr Trump the ultimate protection.  It can be turned into a sealed panic room with oxygen tanks, night-vision camera and reinforced steel plating said to be able to resist bullets, chemical attacks and bombs.The Cadillac has Kevlar-reinforced tyres and steel rims that can keep the vehicle moving even if the tyres have been destroyed.Bottles of the president's blood type are carried on board in case of a medical emergency, and a satellite phone enables communication to be maintained from anywhere in the world.As well as being able to defend the president, the car also features a host of attacking capabilities, such as a pump-action shotgun and a tear gas cannon.The new Russian vehicle is just one of many ways Putin is using symbolism to boost his public image at the summit.He congratulated French winners of the World Cup in St. Petersburg on Sunday night – and Trump turned around and lauded Putin for the successful tournament.When Trump sent out another tweet blasting U.S. 'foolishness and stupidity' for making the U.S. relationship worse than ever, Russia's foreign ministry seized the opportunity, retweeting: 'We agree.' Putin's tarty landing pushed the summit schedule back by an hour and sent a signal to the U.S. government that Moscow is running the show in Helsinki.

title: British firms trading Iran face sanctions WEEKS
story: Donald Trump (pictured in Helsinki today) pulled out of the Iran nuclear agreement in May this year - branding it the 'worst deal in history'Downing Street says there will NOT be a second EU referendum...Desperate May DENIES her Brexit plan is dead despite...Share this articleIn a letter Mr Pompeo said: 'We will seek to provide unprecedented financial pressure on the Iranian regime.  It added that the US is 'not in a position to make exceptions to this policy except in very specific circumstances'.The US President tore up the nuclear deal in May after branding it the 'worst deal in history'.But Britain and other EU countries have tried to salvage the pact and said they are still committed to it.Many British firms swooped in to do lucrative business with Iran  after the pact was signed in 2015.           Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt (pictured heading into No10 today) wants British firms to be exempted from the punitive sanctions looming. But America has rebuffed these requests In 2017, the EU exported £9.5billion worth of goods and services to Iran, according to the BBC.But now British businesses are worried that their lucrative trade with the United States could be harmed if they continue to work with Iran. Earlier this year, the EU began bringing in legislation which the bloc says would allow its companies to continue doing business with Iran.This 'blocking statute' was introduced in 1996 to get around US sanctions on Cuba, although it was never actually used.An updated version of the measure should be in force before 6 August, when the first sanctions take effect.

title: Elderly motorist instructions drive car ploughs vehicle flower festival
story: Paramedics tend to an injured man on the floor after the blue Toyota RAV4 (right) careered through crowds at the flower show          The note that was found inside the vehicle, which read: 'Key in ignition. Foot on brake. Start engine. Gear Lever into D. Foot off brake.'The note read: 'Key in ignition. Foot on brake. Start engine. Gear Lever into D. Foot off brake.'It is believed the elderly woman behind the wheel lost control after putting her foot on the accelerator instead of the break. Treasurer Laurence Rubin, 71, who was thrown from his chair by the car, said he is 'lucky to be alive' after the crash 'knocked' him out. Laurence, from London, said: 'I was sitting in the marquee and suddenly I became aware that I'd been hit and things kept falling on top of me.'I woke up, which makes me believe I was knocked out, to see people around me and the ambulance had been called.          The damaged front of the car after the incident, which sent fete-goers ing for cover as it ploughed through crowds'I feel sorry for the woman because of what has happened but in the same sense I think she has no right to be driving given her track record.  'I have got aches and pains and will be going for a CT scan. I am lucky to be alive.' Dr Diana Black, 53, secretary of the Burnham's Flower Show and Carnival, Norfolk likened the incident to a 'terror attack.'She said: 'It was absolutely terrible.'It was an accident, but when I saw that note I was in disbelief and started to feel angry - if you need written instructions, surely you shouldn't be driving.'Shocking video shows driver, 81, ploughing into cyclists -...Motorists are caught up in a four hour jam as cars back up...Share this article'We were astonished and hugely relieved that there were no fatalities or serious injuries but it was very distressing that all time and effort of the contestants who had entered the competitions in the marquee was virtually ruined.'There could've been fatalities or serious injuries but miraculously there wasn't.'We were also sorry that the locals and visitors were deprived of the main part of what is normally a wonderful and important community event.'Dr Black said the elderly female driver got out of the car shaken up and apologetic.          The aftermath of the incident showing the marquee with the car in the background as bystanders help those injuredEyewitness Annette Lowe, 50, who had been in the tent, said: 'We heard an almighty bang, I turned around and saw this car going through the stage, I just looked on in utter bewilderment.'Although the car was going fast, everything else felt like it was moving in slow motion.'The incident happened around 11.30am on Saturday at the event in Burnham Market, Norfolk.Around 12 people were in the tent at the time of the incident and around 30 people were setting up the show. Dr Black said a few people sustained minor injuries for which she had assisted the paramedics who were called to the scene immediately.Norfolk Police are investigating what happened and considering what action to take, if any. Inspector Lou Provart of Norfolk Police, described the incident as 'an unfortunate, unintended acceleration.' He confirmed no arrests have been made.He added: 'A traffic offence report has been completed and will be submitted for consideration of any offences based on the facts gathered at scene, including the note.'

title: Lost Stanley Kubrick screenplay discovered 60 years
story: A lost screenplay by the late Stanley Kubrick (pictured in 1966) has been discovered after 60 yearsProfessor Abrams told the BBC the screenplay takes the original novella and translates it to Kubrick's contemporary America.He also said it shows parallels with the director's other works – including Lolita, Barry Lyndon, The Shining and Eyes Wide Shut.'Ask Jeffrey Tambor and Jared Leto': How Scarlett...Share this articleThe Kubrick expert said he made the discovery while researching a new book on Eyes Wide Shut – the director's last film before his death in 1999.          The screenplay was found by Nathan Abrams (pictured), a professor of film at Bangor University in WalesThe son of a Kubrick collector, who does not want to be identified, has shown Professor Abrams a copy of the screenplay and it 'seemingly checks out,' he told the BBC.'To find a whole screenplay after 60 years – that's fantastic,' he said.Professor Abrams added to the Observer: 'I couldn't believe it. It's so exciting. It was believed to have been lost.'He said that while Kubrick aficionados are aware that the director wanted to write the screenplay, it wasn't known if it had been complete.'We now have a copy and this proves that he had done a full screenplay.'Professor Abrams believed the unidentified collaborator had been planning to work with Kubrick on Burning Secret.But plans for the project were axed amid rumors of a breach of contract when MGM found out Kubrick was working on anti-war film Paths of Glory with Willingham.Professor Abrams insists it was the studio that axed the film, rather than the screenplay not being good enough.          Kubrick is often cited as one of the most influential directors in the history of cinema. Pictured, a scene from one of his films, 2001: A Space OdysseyHe said the director's producing partner at the time has said Kubrick was 'really excited' about it.'It would be fantastic to see this published, maybe with some commentary, and then eventually someone maybe wants to make it,' he added. Lost Kubrick screenplay found 60 years on by Bangor professor - BBC NewsLost Stanley Kubrick screenplay, Burning Secret, is found 60 years on | Film | The Guardian

title: Black cab driver shares weird wonderful collection photographs taken capital
story: Terry Gibbins has been taking pictures of the capital for 25 years during his work as a black cab driver. This image shows Borough Market in the morning. He says he often blurs images of people because he 'doesn't want them to be identifiable'          Mr Gibbins often photographs London at dawn or in the early evening, including this image looking at Canary Wharf financial district through the Thames barrier. He says the river 'generates so much stuff for me to photograph' and he enjoys taking pictures from several different viewpoints along the Thames          Mr Gibbins says he will often stop to take pictures of people going about their daily lives, including this image taken of a man waiting at a bus stop at Liverpool Street station in front of a back drop of a view of the city from above the clouds. He says he likes ‘figure in the landscape’ shots, and adds: 'Most characters I shoot tend to be blurred, moving or from the back'          The cab driver also takes photos of some of the characters he sees in his cab, like this image of a bookseller outside his shop in Camden Passage, off Upper Street in the London Borough of Islington, north London. He says he will always ask permission to take a picture of anyone that can be identified in his pictures          A stunning early evening image of the Canary Wharf financial district, showing the reflection of the tall tower blocks seen in the still River Thames. It is one of as number of images taken either in the early morning or evening which he says is his favourite time to take pictures  Mr Gibbins with his camera, left, will stop in his cab at any time of day to take pictures, like this image of The Shard through through a window of St Dunstan's in the East (right), the ruins of a church in the City of London which was almost destroyed during the Blitz in 1941. In 1967 the City of London decided to turn the remains into a public garden, which opened in 1970          Mr Gibbins mainly focuses on cityscapes and architecture, but also enjoys taking pictures of some of the  characters who live and work in London. This image shows a man with his back to the camera walking into Westminster Underground station. The photographer says he tries not to identify anyone in his pictures. He said: 'Most characters I shoot tend to be blurred'          One of a number of images of the Shard in central London, taken on the north bank of the River Thames, showing London Bridge in the foreground and a cloudy sky behind.  He says he loves to drive over Lambeth Bridge, and he often starts his day with a stop at his favourite cafe there          This image shows the skyline of of the Canary Wharf financial district in the London Docklands, with One Canada Square visible in the background, as modern residential tower blocks dominate the foreground. Many of Mr Gibbins' photographs contain images of the Thames and canals and he likes experimenting with water abstracts  A woman walks through a covered walkway at Savoy Place on the north bank of the River Thames, and trees are seen in this reflection in a water droplet. Mr Gibbins said: 'My windscreen is my window. It’s ever-changing. It’s one of the things I like about what I do, driving a cab. Every day is different'          He tries to his best to capture the weird and the wonderful of the capital, and will take pictures of the city's animals, like this swan on a canal in Little Venice, an area of north London located in parts of Paddington and Maida Vale in the City of Westminster          A photograph taken from the north shore of the River Thames. It is one of Mr Gibbins many viewpoints he regularly visits to take his stunning images. This one shows Tower Bridge, centre, with the dome shaped City Hall on the left and the Shard in the background          Tourists climbs stairs inside the Sky Garden, at the top of 20 Fenchurch Street, dubbed the 'Walkie Talkie' because of its unique shape. The garden is open to the public and offers incredible views across the city          The Shard, which Mr Gibbens says is one of his favourite buildings to photograph, is pictured here in an office building in Old Billingsgate on Lower Thames Street in the City of London          A man struggles through Regents Park in the snow as blizzard conditions hit the capital. Mr Gibbins says he keeps his photography equipment in the back of his taxi so he never misses an opportunity to take a picture          Red London sky envelops the Canary Wharf financial district in London Docklands. Mr Gibbins says he says he also experiments with water abstracts, and loves taking pictures of buildings around the River Thames, which 'generates so much stuff for me to photograph'          A dog walker with his pet sits on a bench close to the former stately home of Kenwood House on Hampstead Heath in north London          A foggy morning on the banks of the Thames, near Tower Bridge. Mr Gibbins says he likes to take photographs at dawn or in the early evening  A couple take a selfie on steps alongside the River Thames with the clock face of Big Ben behind (left) and another image of the Shard, as seen through the Blitz memorial at Wapping, east London          The Thames barrier covered in mist. title: Cardi B spotted Atlanta hair salon hours gave birth baby Kulture
story: Time to dig in: Cardi B was seen chowing down on her food at an Atlanta hair salon last week just hours before giving birth. She entered the salon at 1.30pm with husband Offset, who was carrying her $2,150 Balenciaga bag          Nom nom nom: The 25-year-old rapper had her hair tied up in a scarf before taking her braids out and then getting it blown out           Cardi and husband Offset welcomed her first child Kulture Kiari Cephus on July 10 She welcomed daughter Kulture Kiari hours later on Tuesday - Cardi's first child and hip-hop artist Offset's fourth.Angela said: 'I was in the salon with a friend while she got her hair done when a couple came in.'At first I didn't think anything of them, until my friend told me it was Cardi B and Offset.'He was holding her bags for her, one of them was a designer bag and the other was a plastic bag with food.'He told her he had to go and let the cleaning lady into their house and he would be back to pick her up later.'She immediately began tucking into her lunch. She was eating some kind of Spanish food. It looked like rice and beans.'She came in with a multi-colored scarf on her head and was getting her cornrows out.'She was getting her hair washed and blown out after.'It's not a fancy place, I never thought I would see anyone famous there.          A customer at the salon told DailyMail.com that the star seemed uncomfortable and expressed a wish to deliver baby Kulture sooner rather than later  Cardi, wearing a floral halter dress, had her braids taken out, a wash, and a blow out after          Last month she revealed she has been married to rapper Offset since last September 'It looked like she was a regular though because nobody batted an eyelid when she walked in the door.'Angela said the star seemed uncomfortable and expressed a wish to deliver baby Kulture sooner rather than later.'I said to her she looked ready to pop and she just said I wish.'   On Friday Cardi B gave her fans her first update on parenthood, admitting being a mother demands her attention 'all day and all night.'The rapper posted on Instagram, apologizing to her followers for the lack of replies to the congratulatory messages as she gets to grips with the demands of her daughter.Pete Davidson hits back at critics after fiance Ariana...Having fun! Little Louis beams with delight and proud mum is...Share this article'Thank you everybody for the congrats we really appreciated❤️. Thank you to family and friends that’s been hitting me up checking on me,' she wrote.'It’s been a little hard for me to reply back cause this mommy job requires full day, all day, all night attention. I love you guys. Thanking all my fans as well for the love and support. I love you guys !!I’ll try to post more often.'The new mother also shared an update on her Twitter page, admitting she now understands the importance of letting a newborn snooze.'When parents say “if you wake the baby up YOU PUTTING HER BACK TO SLEEP!” I feel that,' she quipped.The Be Careful hitmaker, 25, has reportedly already splashed out $7,000 on Kulture with her nursery designed with items from high end West Hollywood baby boutique, Couture Kids on Robertson.

title: Pranksters hilarious chat St George flag seller wanted 3 item goes viral
story: Jon Pilkington, 26, took the chance to poke fun at a Facebook seller after he attempted to flog a flag A prankster who hilariously bartered for a £3 England flag after his team came crashing out of the World Cup has gone viral.Jon Pilkington took the opportunity to have some fun on Facebook after he spotted the accessory, adorned with the St George's cross, for sale.The father-of-one approached a seller the day after England crashed out the World Cup semi-final, and could not resist teasing him.  The 26-year-old from Plymouth, Devon, bombarded the seller with a series of ridiculous questions - including how gracefully the flag fluttered - to which surprisingly the owner obliged with answers.Jon, a property developer, said: 'I was reminiscing over England getting so close, and falling apart.'It had been a hard few days of my life and I was still coming to terms with the grief and upset.'So I gathered the strength to reach for my phone and I began to search for England memorabilia - some called it blind loyalty, some call it addiction, but I call it a love for my country.'And that's when I came across this guy selling a flag for £3. I found it hilarious.'          The chat began with Jon asking for a picture of 'the other side' of the flag from the Facebook sellerDuring the protracted negotiations, Jon asked the man 'how does it cope under windy conditions mate? Does it gracefully flutter or is it more of a wobble?' to which the seller replied 'gracefully'.He even asked for the unnamed seller to take a picture of the other side of the flag - despite it being translucent.But the 26-year-old claimed it was only during the process of considering whether to buy the flag he realised it was damaged with a hole - and despite offering £1.83, this was rejected.          Jon insisted he wanted an image of the other side of the translucent flag from the person selling it over the internet           The seller obliged but refused to lie down next to the flag for a photo to give an idea of its size           The father-of-one prankster continued to make bizarre requests during the conversation, last Thursday          The seller said it was 'white and red' rather than 'red and white' when asked by Mr Pilkington          The hilarious conversation went on with the man finally revealing the flag has a hole in it - although he mis-typed it 'hoe'          The seller who was clearly still fooled even took a picture of the hole to send to the potential buyer Jon, who is dad to a six-year-old boy, said he has been hit with social media trolling of his own with many online commentators criticizing his post.He said: 'Never in my life have I bullied anyone nor was I then - it's good to have some fun on social media, as long as it's in good taste.'If people feel sorry for the guy, then from what I can see he's trying to sell loads of stuff.'By all means drop him a message and help him out financially.'If anyone would be interested to purchase the flag, then my research shows it's still available.'However they should know from the start, there is a hole.'This information was not made apparent to me until it was nearly too late.'           The conversation ended when the seller refused to take £1.83 for the flag after the revelation it had a hole in it

title: Lift horror Girl China slammed ceiling lift tying string waist
story: Ruirui is pulled up by the waist after typing a rope around herself before going into the lift          She is slammed to the ceiling as the lift went down from the 23rd floor in a building in ChinaThe battle of the TOE: Contestants put their best foot...Driver survives after being impaled by four bamboo poles in...Share this articleRuirui was luckily saved after her elder brother quickly untied the rope from his waist and called the lift back to the 23rd floor.It's said that the pair were being looked after by their grandmother when the accident occurred in the Huadou district of Guangzhou, Guangdong Province, on July 10.The siblings reportedly found a rope and tied it to themselves while playing by the lift, according to Guangdong Public Channel.Ruirui then walked into the lift while her brother was standing outside.Surveillance camera footage shows Ruirui being pulled up in the air as the lift goes down. She then fell to the ground.Ruirui was carried out of the lift when the lift returned to the 23rd floor.           The seven-year-old falls onto the ground after her brother untied the rope around his waist          Ruirui's 14-year-old brother carries her out of the lift after calling the lift back to the 23rd floor          The girl has sustained minor injuries on the knees and head after the terrifying accidentShe sustained minor injuries on the knees and the head, according to the report.The children's mother, Ms Zhao, rushed back home after their grandmother called her. She sent her daughter to a nearby hospital for treatment.Apparently, the mother believed the accident had been caused by the lift's faulty sensors. She told the Guangdong Public Channel that the lift sensors 'had not been working'.'Sometimes I put my hands between the doors, the lift failed to detect and kept shutting,' she said.Mr Huang who inspects lifts in the area told the reporters that all lifts have passed strict mechanic examination.But he pointed out that the rope could be in a blind spot and the sensors failed to detect it, thus the doors shut and did not re-open.The report said Mr Huang had raised the issue of the lift sensors to his company.

title: I did 20 workouts 48 hours dont to
story: Mail on Sunday's deputy health editor Eve Simmons, pictured in San Diego, California attended the world's largest exercise eventStreams of fluorescent disco lights flood the 4,000-capacity auditorium. Around me an army of eager, Lycra-clad men and women stand in neat rows, shoulder width apart, eyes widened. Ear-bleedingly loud dance music pumps through the speakers as Heidi and Chris Powell – the stars of US hit reality show Extreme Weight Loss – take the stage to lead an exercise class that will help us reach our ‘pain threshold’ and ‘burn optimum body fat’.Someone in the crowd screams. Another cries. It’s not yet 7.30am. Welcome to the first day of the world’s biggest fitness convention: Idea World, in San Diego, southern California.Dubbed the ‘superbowl of the fitness industry’, the annual event brings together more than 200 fitness industry professionals, trainers and celebrity weight-loss gurus, alongside 14,000 exercise fanatics from all around the globe.They flock to the four-day festival to find the latest innovations and trends in workouts, equipment and technology on offer. And what debuts here quickly makes its way into gyms across the Atlantic.Justin Webb: Why I'll stick with walking my labradoodle...I can cry and scream when I'm running: TANA RAMSAY explains...Share this articleThe expo has launched countless products, machines and exercises during its 36-year run, from vibrating power plates to Zumba.As a long-time exercise-avoider with minimal muscle mass, I’ve always struggled to find an exercise class I enjoy. So, as the only British journalist invited to attend this year, would I discover one I could actually bear?COULD I GET MADONNA’S BOTTOM?The exhaustive list of almost 400 classes, workouts and evening activities at Idea World is overwhelming I commit to 25 classes over a period of 48 hours.Only the most sweat-inducing make my cut.After the Powells’ Extreme Transformation Workout, an endless series of muscle-toning exercises performed for three minutes at a time, I move on to a BOSU class: exercises practised aboard a squishy rubber dome.Instructor Alison demonstrates how to ‘paddle’ with my steel bar in hand, engaging the core and glutes for ‘bums and tums’ tightening.          Over the course of 48 hours, Eve tried out 20 different work outs at the Idea World fitness convention in San Diego, CaliforniaFinding my balance on the rubber sphere is tough enough let alone extending opposite arm and legs simultaneously. Remarkably, by focusing on a spot on the wall in front of me, I’m able to complete the rest of the routine with minimal wobbling.After Tae Bo, a mixture of martial arts and aerobics, comes Booty Barre – a class especially designed to build a beautiful bottom.The workout – whose fans include Madonna – draws on the principles of Pilates and ballet.As a regular Pilates goer, I was fairly confident I’d get through the hour with ease, but after five minutes of thrusting with a medicine ball between my legs – on tiptoes – I realise this isn’t the case.By the end of the class, my thighs are like jelly and I’m starving hungry. It’s 10am.BOOT CAMP, BOXING... AND BATTLE ROPESI decide to get the worst out the way before lunchtime: army boot camp.Developed by a former US sergeant, this is a 90-minute sweatathon involving jumping squats, lunges and sprints interspersed with military-style marches. Angry orders from Sergeant Ken Weichart (aka Sgt Ken) to ‘Embrace The Pain!’ keep me moving despite the agony but after 50 rapid squats and the sergeant’s demands to ‘get lower’, I succumb to the pain and embarrassingly stumble mid-rep. ‘No quitters here!’ Ken loudly reminds me.I manage a 30-minute lunch break before leaping straight into the on-site boxing ring for a couple of rounds with a bullish, bald-headed former champ.          This odd-looking device is supposed to provide a work out for bums and tumsTo my surprise, I can throw a mean punch and even manage a spin, kick and smack move.Then I move across to Battle Ropes. After 15 minutes of tutorial, we experiment with all 30 ways a 55 lb, 50ft rope can be moved about for a vigorous full-body workout.It’s not all about waving it with the hands – try jumping between two ropes for a quick warm-up, or lifting the ropes in between press-ups to work the core and arms. At the end of the class, I unashamedly collapse on the floor into a pool of my own sweat and admit defeat. Tomorrow is another day…TORTURE... FOR KILLER ABSOn day two, I explore the 500,000 square foot exhibition hall showcasing almost 400 cutting-edge fitness gadgets and machinery.I start with a demonstration of the latest vibrating Power Plate to hit US gyms. The machine stimulates muscles with vibration, increasing muscle tone when exercising. I expect to watch my love handles wiggle off my body without moving but unfortunately, some work is required. I try step-ups and single leg balances, before moving on to planks, bridges and seated crunches – all aboard the vibrating platform. Each exercise feels ten times more intense than I’d ever experienced before, with ripples of pain shooting through my entire body.Converts claim that those ten minutes of excruciating torture are the fastest route to killer abs.Other highlights of the exhibition include a 6ft stair-climbing machine which, on maximum resistance, feels five times harder than normal stairs a virtual-reality treadmill that sends me running through the French countryside and a cycling machine called Real Ryder which tilts 22 degrees and emits stimulating vibrations. I disembark the bike, feeling two stone lighter, and seek out an upper-body exercise to give my legs some well-earned rest.          Eve, right, pictured with Sgt Ken Weichert, left, is receiving her orders 2 GET PULSED danceWHAT IS IT?A 60-minute class using weights to tone the lower body. Movements are syncronised to song lyrics making routines easy to follow.HOW DOES IT HELP?More than 600 calories are burned in just one hour.HOW DO I FIND OUT MORE?Not available in the UK yet, but see getpulsed.com. Search for a dance class local to you at emduk.org.3 BILLY BLANKS  tae-boWHAT IS IT?A total body workout combining kick-boxing, martial arts, aerobics and self-defence.HOW DOES IT HELP?Dynamic punching and kicking to upbeat pop music improves both cardiovascular fitness and muscle strength.HOW DO I FIND OUT MORE?Blanks’s how-to exercise videos are free at taebo.com.4 BOLLY-X dance classWHAT IS IT?A 50-minute dance-based class inspired by Bollywood routines.HOW DOES IT HELP?Instructors don’t stop throughout the class, expecting you to catch up as they move seamlessly through movements. The result is 50 minutes of non-stop cardio workout.HOW DO I FIND OUT MORE?BollyX classes are yet to hit the UK but online workouts are available at bod.bollyx.com costing £6.79 per month.5 PIYO (Pilates plus yoga)WHAT IS IT?PiYo is a 25-minute, ramped-up Pilates and yoga hybrid pioneered by celebrity trainer Charlene Johnson. Fluid sequences are speeded-up and movements are dynamic and challenging.HOW DOES IT HELP?The fast pace burns more fat than a standard yoga or Pilates class, while maintaining the flexibility benefits.HOW DO I FIND OUT MORE?Search for your nearest PiYo class at beachbody live.com.

title: Tearjerking moment girl asks stepfather adopt her
story: Gus Roman flicks through an adorable photo album showing pictures of the two of them. Alexa holding the photo album she made for her stepfather, showing the life-changing picture on the final page          Gus and Alexa when she was a little girl. The doting father had always wanted to adopt her          An adorable picture of Alexa and Gus on the front of the Father's Day photo album she gave himThe family decided they would surprise Gus on Father's Day, the same day Alexa's father died. They wanted to make happy memories on the heartbreaking anniversary and Mia filmed the emotion moment.          Unbreakable bond: Alexa and Gus have always been close. In total, police said they arrested 292 people across France  Looters were also filmed breaking into a Lacoste store in Paris before making away with armfuls of goods from insideThe trouble continued into Monday morning with officers were called to a Nike store on the Champs-Élysées when crowds built up eager to get their hands on new football shirts featuring a second star above the team badge to denote the win.Following minor scuffles, it was announced that the shirts would not  be put on general sale until Tuesday. Police are remaining in situ in Paris ahead of a victory parade by the Les Bleus team when they get back from Russia later on Monday.          French newspapers plastered images of the World Cup victory across their front pages on Monday morningIn honour of the victory several Paris metro stations had their names changed on Monday morning, with Champs-Élysées Clemenceau renamed Deschamps-Élysées, after coach Didier Deschamps.The station of Bercy also has its name changed to Bercy les Blues, which sounds like Merci les Blues.Two football fans have died in France overnight as World Cup celebrations were marred by violence following the national side's victory over Croatia in Moscow.Police forces fired tear gas as scuffles and pockets of looting broke out on the Champs-Élysées where a million people partied into the night. Revellers set off smoke bombs in the national colours - blue, white and red - obscuring Napoleon's triumphal arch as officers  tackled the crowd using water canons.People climbed on newspaper kiosks and bus stops in the area to wave flags while the Marseillaise national anthem rang out and cars honked their horns following the final whistle. title: Elderly motorist instructions drive car ploughs vehicle flower festival
story: Paramedics tend to an injured man on the floor after the blue Toyota RAV4 (right) careered through crowds at the flower show          The note that was found inside the vehicle, which read: 'Key in ignition. Foot on brake. Start engine. Gear Lever into D. Foot off brake.'The note read: 'Key in ignition. Foot on brake. Start engine. Gear Lever into D. Foot off brake.'It is believed the elderly woman behind the wheel lost control after putting her foot on the accelerator instead of the break. Treasurer Laurence Rubin, 71, who was thrown from his chair by the car, said he is 'lucky to be alive' after the crash 'knocked' him out. Laurence, from London, said: 'I was sitting in the marquee and suddenly I became aware that I'd been hit and things kept falling on top of me.'I woke up, which makes me believe I was knocked out, to see people around me and the ambulance had been called.          The damaged front of the car after the incident, which sent fete-goers ing for cover as it ploughed through crowds'I feel sorry for the woman because of what has happened but in the same sense I think she has no right to be driving given her track record.  'I have got aches and pains and will be going for a CT scan. I am lucky to be alive.' Dr Diana Black, 53, secretary of the Burnham's Flower Show and Carnival, Norfolk likened the incident to a 'terror attack.'She said: 'It was absolutely terrible.'It was an accident, but when I saw that note I was in disbelief and started to feel angry - if you need written instructions, surely you shouldn't be driving.'Shocking video shows driver, 81, ploughing into cyclists -...Motorists are caught up in a four hour jam as cars back up...Share this article'We were astonished and hugely relieved that there were no fatalities or serious injuries but it was very distressing that all time and effort of the contestants who had entered the competitions in the marquee was virtually ruined.'There could've been fatalities or serious injuries but miraculously there wasn't.'We were also sorry that the locals and visitors were deprived of the main part of what is normally a wonderful and important community event.'Dr Black said the elderly female driver got out of the car shaken up and apologetic.          The aftermath of the incident showing the marquee with the car in the background as bystanders help those injuredEyewitness Annette Lowe, 50, who had been in the tent, said: 'We heard an almighty bang, I turned around and saw this car going through the stage, I just looked on in utter bewilderment.'Although the car was going fast, everything else felt like it was moving in slow motion.'The incident happened around 11.30am on Saturday at the event in Burnham Market, Norfolk.Around 12 people were in the tent at the time of the incident and around 30 people were setting up the show. Dr Black said a few people sustained minor injuries for which she had assisted the paramedics who were called to the scene immediately.Norfolk Police are investigating what happened and considering what action to take, if any. Inspector Lou Provart of Norfolk Police, described the incident as 'an unfortunate, unintended acceleration.' He confirmed no arrests have been made.He added: 'A traffic offence report has been completed and will be submitted for consideration of any offences based on the facts gathered at scene, including the note.'

title: Lost Stanley Kubrick screenplay discovered 60 years
story: A lost screenplay by the late Stanley Kubrick (pictured in 1966) has been discovered after 60 yearsProfessor Abrams told the BBC the screenplay takes the original novella and translates it to Kubrick's contemporary America.He also said it shows parallels with the director's other works – including Lolita, Barry Lyndon, The Shining and Eyes Wide Shut.'Ask Jeffrey Tambor and Jared Leto': How Scarlett...Share this articleThe Kubrick expert said he made the discovery while researching a new book on Eyes Wide Shut – the director's last film before his death in 1999.          The screenplay was found by Nathan Abrams (pictured), a professor of film at Bangor University in WalesThe son of a Kubrick collector, who does not want to be identified, has shown Professor Abrams a copy of the screenplay and it 'seemingly checks out,' he told the BBC.'To find a whole screenplay after 60 years – that's fantastic,' he said.Professor Abrams added to the Observer: 'I couldn't believe it. It's so exciting. It was believed to have been lost.'He said that while Kubrick aficionados are aware that the director wanted to write the screenplay, it wasn't known if it had been complete.'We now have a copy and this proves that he had done a full screenplay.'Professor Abrams believed the unidentified collaborator had been planning to work with Kubrick on Burning Secret.But plans for the project were axed amid rumors of a breach of contract when MGM found out Kubrick was working on anti-war film Paths of Glory with Willingham.Professor Abrams insists it was the studio that axed the film, rather than the screenplay not being good enough.          Kubrick is often cited as one of the most influential directors in the history of cinema. Pictured, a scene from one of his films, 2001: A Space OdysseyHe said the director's producing partner at the time has said Kubrick was 'really excited' about it.'It would be fantastic to see this published, maybe with some commentary, and then eventually someone maybe wants to make it,' he added. Lost Kubrick screenplay found 60 years on by Bangor professor - BBC NewsLost Stanley Kubrick screenplay, Burning Secret, is found 60 years on | Film | The Guardian

title: Lift horror Girl China slammed ceiling lift tying string waist
story: Ruirui is pulled up by the waist after typing a rope around herself before going into the lift          She is slammed to the ceiling as the lift went down from the 23rd floor in a building in ChinaThe battle of the TOE: Contestants put their best foot...Driver survives after being impaled by four bamboo poles in...Share this articleRuirui was luckily saved after her elder brother quickly untied the rope from his waist and called the lift back to the 23rd floor.It's said that the pair were being looked after by their grandmother when the accident occurred in the Huadou district of Guangzhou, Guangdong Province, on July 10.The siblings reportedly found a rope and tied it to themselves while playing by the lift, according to Guangdong Public Channel.Ruirui then walked into the lift while her brother was standing outside.Surveillance camera footage shows Ruirui being pulled up in the air as the lift goes down. She then fell to the ground.Ruirui was carried out of the lift when the lift returned to the 23rd floor.           The seven-year-old falls onto the ground after her brother untied the rope around his waist          Ruirui's 14-year-old brother carries her out of the lift after calling the lift back to the 23rd floor          The girl has sustained minor injuries on the knees and head after the terrifying accidentShe sustained minor injuries on the knees and the head, according to the report.The children's mother, Ms Zhao, rushed back home after their grandmother called her. She sent her daughter to a nearby hospital for treatment.Apparently, the mother believed the accident had been caused by the lift's faulty sensors. She told the Guangdong Public Channel that the lift sensors 'had not been working'.'Sometimes I put my hands between the doors, the lift failed to detect and kept shutting,' she said.Mr Huang who inspects lifts in the area told the reporters that all lifts have passed strict mechanic examination.But he pointed out that the rope could be in a blind spot and the sensors failed to detect it, thus the doors shut and did not re-open.The report said Mr Huang had raised the issue of the lift sensors to his company.

title: new brighton revisited three decades in pictures
